SEARCH
Package jdbc

Class JDBCSignal

java.lang.Object
jdbc.JDBCSignal
All Implemented Interfaces:
SignalManager
public class JDBCSignal extends Object implements SignalManager
Implementation of the SignalManager interface using JDBC for managing persistence operations related to signal records in the database. This class handles CRUD operations for the 'signal' table and complex queries involving joins with 'medicalhistory' and 'client'.

    • addSignal

      public void addSignal(Signal signal)
      Inserts a new signal record into the 'signal' table.
      Specified by:
      addSignal in interface SignalManager
      Parameters:
      signal - The Signal object to insert, containing the type, file path, and associated record ID.

    • getSignalById

      public Signal getSignalById(int signalId)
      Retrieves a specific Signal record from the database using its unique signal ID.
      Specified by:
      getSignalById in interface SignalManager
      Parameters:
      signalId - The unique ID of the signal to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The populated Signal object, or null if the signal is not found or an error occurs.

    • getSignalsByRecordId

      public List<Signal> getSignalsByRecordId(int recordId)
      Retrieves all signal records associated with a specific medical history record ID.
      Specified by:
      getSignalsByRecordId in interface SignalManager
      Parameters:
      recordId - The ID of the medical history record whose signals are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A list of Signal objects associated with the record. Returns an empty list if none are found.

    • getSignalsByClientId

      public List<Signal> getSignalsByClientId(int clientId)
      Retrieves a list of all signal records associated with a specific client ID.

      This operation involves a JOIN between the 'signal' and 'medicalhistory' tables to filter by the client's ID.

      Specified by:
      getSignalsByClientId in interface SignalManager
      Parameters:
      clientId - The ID of the client whose signals are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A list of Signal objects associated with the client.

    • getSignalTypeByRecordId

      public TypeSignal getSignalTypeByRecordId(int recordId)
      Retrieves the type (ECG or EMG) of the signal associated with a given medical history record ID.

      Assumes a medical history record generally has only one type of signal for determination.

      Specified by:
      getSignalTypeByRecordId in interface SignalManager
      Parameters:
      recordId - The ID of the medical history record.
      Returns:
      The TypeSignal enum value (ECG or EMG), or null if no signal is found for the record.

    • getClientIdBySignalId

      public int getClientIdBySignalId(int signalId)
      Retrieves the client ID associated with a specific signal ID.

      This requires joining the 'signal', 'medicalhistory', and 'client' tables.

      Specified by:
      getClientIdBySignalId in interface SignalManager
      Parameters:
      signalId - The ID of the signal whose owner is to be determined.
      Returns:
      The ID of the client who owns the signal, or -1 if the signal or client association is not found.
